name: prokaryote
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of organism that has only one cell and does not have a nucleus (= central part), for example a bacterium: The eukaryotic cell is much larger and more efficient than the procaryote, carrying more genetic material. All the contents of the cells of prokaryote organisms (which lack a cell nucleus) are contained within the cytoplasm. Compare
eukaryote
More examplesFewer examplesThe term prokaryote is Greek for "preliminary cell".Some scientists suggest that the procaryote is a degenerate eukaryote, one that has lost its unique features.Consider first a single-cell organism, a prokaryote.
